intro: Libanotis vulgaris, commonly known as the common libanotis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Europe and western Asia, often found in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant features small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in umbels, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a distinctive silvery underside that gives it a striking appearance. Libanotis vulgaris is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a historical use in traditional medicine.
